IRS990.MissionDesc: THROUGH THE LOVE OF JESUS CHRIST, RALEIGH RESCUE MISSION TRANSFORMS LIVES OF MEN, WOMEN, AND CHILDREN EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS BY MINISTERING TO THEIR PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL, AND SPIRITUAL NEEDS.
IRS990.Desc: RALEIGH RESCUE MISSION IS A CHRISTIAN ORGANIZATION THAT SERVES MEN, WOMEN, AND CHILDREN EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS. THE MISSION HELPS PEOPLE WHO WANT TO MOVE FROM HOMELESSNESS TO LONG TERM STABILITY. THE NEW LIFE PLAN PROGRAM OFFERS A PLAN THAT STARTS WITH ASSESSING AND PROVIDING BASIC PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL AND SPIRITUAL NEEDS. THE ROOT CAUSES OF POVERTY, INCLUDING THE ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EFFECTS OF TRAUMA AND CHRONIC STRESS, ARE ADDRESSED SO THAT WE CAN HELP PEOPLE REBUILD THE FOUNDATION THEY NEED TO BECOME SELF-SUFFICIENT.THE NEW LIFE PLAN OFFERS LONG-TERM SOLUTIONS TO ENDING HOMELESSNESS AND BREAKING THE CYCLE OF POVERTY. THE NEW LIFE PLAN CONSISTS OF SIX PHASES WHICH INCLUDES MEDICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH ASSESSMENTS, LIFE SKILLS SUPPORT, VOCATIONAL TRAINING, COUNSELING, TUTORING, EMPLOYMENT PREPARATION, PURCHASING A CAR, SAVING MONEY, CHILDREN'S TUTORING, NON-SUBSIDIZED HOUSING, CREDIT COUNSELING, STEADY EMPLOYMENT, HOMEOWERSHIP, AND A PATH TOWARDS CONTINUED SUCCESS.* CLIENTS SERVED: IN THE PAST YEAR, THE RALEIGH RESCUE MISSION HAS HELPED 703 INDIVIDUALS (MEN, WOMEN, AND CHILDREN) THROUGH OUR LONG-TERM AND SHORT-TERM HOUSING PROGRAM. THE MISSION EXPANDED THE LONG-TERM PROGRAM CAPACITY TO EFFECTIVELY ASSIST MORE CLIENTS IN OBTAINING LONG-TERM STABILITY. THE SHORT-TERM HOUSING PROGRAM IS OFFERED DURING THE WINTER MONTHS DURING WHITE FLAG CONDITIONS (I.E.TEMPERATURE BELOW 38 DEGREES WITH PERCIPITATION OR 32 DEGREES). THE MISSION PROVIDED 11,113 NIGHTS OF SAFE LODGING AND 142,350 MEALS TO MEN, WOMEN, AND CHILDREN IN OUR PROGRAM.* EDUCATION COMPONENT: CLIENTS PARTICIPATE IN LIFE SKILLS, JOB READINESS, COMPUTER BASICS, AND VOCATIONAL TRAINING CLASSES. THERE WERE OVER 323,272 STUDENT HOURS DEVOTED TO PREPARING CLIENTS FOR EMPLOYMENT.* CHILDREN'S MINISTRY: THE MISSION EXPANDED THE SERVICES FOR OUR CHILDREN. AN EDUCATION ASSESSMENTS AND DEVELOPMENTAL ASSESSMENTS ARE OFFERED FOR EACH CHILD TO AVOID DELAYS AND TO INTERVENE FOR IMPROVING THE LIFE OF EACH CHILD. ASSESSING EACH SCHOOL AGE CHILD IS NEW. ALL CHILDREN AGED 4 -17 ARE NOW RECEIVING INDIVIDUAL ASSESSMENTS AND TUTORING BY SYLVAN LEARNING. CHILDREN HAVE PARTICIPATED IN 380 HOURS OF TUTORING. THE W. E. MANGUM CHILDREN'S DEVELOPMENTAL CENTER ASSISTED AN AVERAGE OF FIVE PRESCHOOLERS PER DAY AND NINTEEN DISCRETE PRESCHOOLERS DURING THE YEAR. CHILDREN IN THE CHILDREN'S DEVELOPMENT CENTER ENGAGED IN 58,560 HOURS OF STUDENT LEARNING. THE MISSION IS COMMITTED TO HELPING CHILDREN BE RESILIENT, OVERCOME SOCIAL AND EDUCATIONAL BARRIERS, PARTICULARLY IN ABILITY TO READ AT GRADE LEVEL. THIS WILL HELP A CHILD SUCCEED IN SCHOOL AND BE ENCOURAGED TO BREAK POSSIBLE GENERATIONAL POVERTY AND HOMELESSNESS IN THEIR LIVES IN THE FUTURE.* HOUSING: SEVENTEEN INDIVIDUALS MOVED INTO HOUSING DURING THE PAST YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IT IS THE MISSION'S POLICY TO EVALUATE ALL TAX POSITIONS TO IDENTIFY THOSE THAT MAY BE CONSIDERED UNCERTAIN. ALL IDENTIFIED MATERIAL TAX POSITIONS ARE ASSESSED AND MEASURED BY A "MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT" THRESHOLD TO DETERMINE IF THE BENEFIT OF ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITION SHOULD BE RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. ANY CHANGES IN THE AMOUNT OF A TAX POSITION ARE RECOGNIZED IN THE PERIOD THE CHANGE OCCURS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FATHER AND SON SERVE ON THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, FRED SMITH AND JULE SMITH.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE RALEIGH RESCUE MISSION, INC'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEW AND APPROVE FORM 990 AT A MONTHLY BOARD MEETING PRIOR TO FORM 990 BEING FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL BOARD MEMBERS ARE ASKED TO SIGN THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE CONDUCTS AN ANNUAL EVALUATION IN THE SPRING OF EACH YEAR OF THE CEO'S PERFORMANCE AND PROVIDES FEEDBACK TO THE CEO. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE WORKS WITH THE FINANCE COMMITTEE TO ESTABLISH THE CEO AND STAFF COMPENSATION PACKAGE FOR THE UPCOMING YEAR. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE'S PROCESS FOR SETTING THE SALARY OF THE CEO IS PURSUANT TO THE POLICY FOR EXCELLENCE IN COMPENSATION-SETTING AS SET BY THE EVANGELICAL COUNCIL OF FINANCIAL ACCOUNTABILITY (ECFA).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE RALEIGH RESCUE MISSION, INC. IS NOT REQUIRED TO PROVIDE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS TO THE PUBLIC. HOWEVER IF A POTENTIAL DONOR WOULD LIKE TO REVIEW THIS INFORMATION IT WOULD BE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
INCREASE IN CASH SURRENDER VALUE OF LIFE INSURANCE 2,856.
FORM 990, PART XI LINE 2C: THE RALEIGH RESCUE MISSION, INC'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT, REVIEW OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT AUDITOR.
